title: System Engineer/System architect
description:
The Art of Building Autonomous Warehouse Vehicles
  
  

From simple forklifts to advanced systems of guided and autonomous vehicles for transporting materials around the clock - our industry has gone through a significant change. In this role, you're a central part in this progress. Here at Toyota, we are in the midst of creating the next generation of autonomous warehouse vehicles, and your expertise is the key to our success.
  
  

If you are passionate about being part of an ambitious team focused on cutting-edge technology in autonomous driving and want the opportunity to develop and make an impact, this is your chance!
  
Your team and tasks to look forward to
  
Design system solutions for auto products, including hardware and software.
  
Define requirements and ensure standard compliance for the products.
  
Work closely with project and product management with technical development responsibility.
  
Work with technologies such as camera or lidar, e.g. positioning, localisation and vision perception.
  
You will be part of Toyota Material Handling Auto Solutions, consisting of approximately 60 people. As part of our systems team, you will work closely with project and product management as well as development teams to drive technical development forward and ensure that the products reach their goals. Your main focus is the vehicle, where you and your team are responsible for developing new models of the vehicle, as well as enhancing existing models and defining customer-specific solutions. In addition to the technology for the vehicle, you need to understand related systems, such as fleet and warehouse management. You work close to the end products as the test lab and production are placed just around the corner.
  
In this role you get to use your experience in systems engineering as well as your technical knowledge and creative ability to design system solutions for auto products, where both hardware and software are integrated to create optimal results. Furthermore, it is important to develop strategies for systems, subsystems and components together with driving innovation within your team and in collaboration with other functions within Auto Solutions. You will also be expected to monitor technological developments within our industry and related areas to ensure we are at the forefront with our products.
  
  

More about you
  
PhD or Master's degree in computer science or Master of Science in Engineering, or equivalent.
  
Experience in systems engineering with focus on software.
  
Experience and good ability to translate market requirements into product requirements and system architecture.
  
Proficiency in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
  
We are looking for candidates experienced in requirements management and functional safety, which involves carrying out fault mode analyses and risk assessments to ensure product performance and reliability. Desirable qualifications include knowledge and experience within ISO 3691-4 and functional safety ISO- 13849. We highly value collaborative teamwork and a proactive attitude towards knowledge sharing, along with a commitment to deliver high-quality results.
  
  

Application
  
Welcome with your application no later than 2024-08-11. The selection process will begin after the application deadline.
  
  

If you are applying for a job and have a protected identity you should contact HR, who will guide you further for a secure application process.
  
  

**For more information please contact:**  

Eva Hådding, Software Manager, 0705 08 47 40
  
Mattias Arnsby, System Responsible, 0703 05 68 20
  
Daniella Möller, HR, daniella.moller@toyota-industries.eu
  
**Instagram:** ToyotaMHsweden
  
**Linkedin:** Toyota Material Handling Manufacturing Sweden AB

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**About Us:** 
 we are pioneers in creating cutting-edge AI-driven solutions that transform the way content is produced and experienced. Our innovative platform empowers creators to deliver immersive live experiences with unmatched quality. We are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and are looking for a dedicated QA Engineer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 As a QA Engineer specializing in manual and software testing, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the highest quality of our products. You will work closely with our development and production teams to identify and resolve defects before they reach our customers. If you are detail-oriented, love problem-solving, and have a passion for technology, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Conduct thorough manual testing of our software applications to identify defects and ensure quality standards are met.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and provide feedback on usability and functionality.
* Develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts based on product specifications.
* Document and track defects, ensuring timely resolution and retesting.
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to enhance overall quality.
* Assist in developing and maintaining testing documentation and processes.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in software testing.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Proven experience in manual testing of software applications.
* Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and testing methodologies.
* Familiarity with bug tracking tools and test management software.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Must be located in Stockholm.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work with a talented team on innovative AI technology.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A vibrant and inclusive company culture.



  





 If you are excited about contributing to a pioneering company in the AI industry and meet the qualifications outlined above, we encourage you to apply!
 



  





  





  





**Join Us in Shaping the Future of AI Production!**

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Coalsese Management Consulting is seeking a skilled and experienced
 **Embedded Software Engineer** 
 to join our team in the automotive domain. Your mission will be to help bring a Chinese-sourced Battery Management System (BMS) up to European safety and software standards, ensuring compliance with EU regulations and alignment with industry best practices, including ISO 26262. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of cutting-edge battery technology and high automotive safety standards, contributing to the electrification revolution.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Analyze the existing BMS software and identify gaps related to EU safety and software standards.
* Redesign or modify software components to meet ISO 26262 and other relevant standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware, systems, and safety engineers, to ensure an integrated approach.
* Develop and implement embedded software for real-time battery management, focusing on safety-critical applications.
* Conduct software validation and verification, including unit testing, integration testing, and system-level testing.
* Create and maintain technical documentation, such as software architecture, requirements, and traceability matrices.
* Support compliance and certification activities, including preparing for audits or safety assessments.
* Act as a technical liaison between the Chinese supplier and internal/external stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and alignment.



  





**Required Skills and Experience:** 



* **5+ years** 
 of experience in embedded software development, preferably in the automotive industry.
* Expertise in
 **real-time systems** 
 and programming languages like
 **C/C++** 
 .
* Proven knowledge of
 **battery management systems (BMS)** 
 or other power electronics.
* Familiarity with
 **ISO 26262** 
 and other safety standards relevant to automotive systems.
* Hands-on experience with communication protocols such as
 **CAN, LIN, UART** 
 , or similar.
* Strong debugging, testing, and troubleshooting skills for embedded systems.
* Experience working with cross-functional, multicultural teams.



  





 You would be able to operate as an independent consultant for this assignment, which I can support with.
 **You will need your own AB company or at least be able to set one up, if you cannot do this we politely ask you do not apply for this role in order to save all parties involved time.** 
 If you are not available for a new project now, we offer a generous referral scheme. If this assignment is of interest to you. To speed up your application, when replying please provide an up-to-date copy of your CV along with your contact information.
 



  





**Get in touch:** 




  





 Learn more about Coalesce Management Consulting, our projects, and the support we provide to our consultants at https://expertisedelivered.com
 



  





 No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

title: Development Engineer
description:
**About Scania**
 For Scania, the most valuable asset is our people. Scania has a strong and supportive working culture where each individual is seen, respected, and trusted. Scania’s organizational environment enables you to develop and grow professionally and personally in the best possible way.
   

  

 Scania has over 600.000 (and counting) vehicles and other connected products that continuously create new data. A key factor for Scania to succeed in the Digital Shift and one of Scania’s sustainability goals is to enable flexible and usable access to data in large volumes.
   

  

 96% of Scania’s carbon emissions come from our products, enabling and leveraging the data that we collect to improve our products and help our customers utilize them in a more efficient way, is one important component for reaching our science-based targets.
   

  

 We are looking for a curious data scientist to help us drive the development of new data initiatives in our projects within electrification, autonomy, and connectivity. Do you want to be a part of this journey?
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 Today our R&D teams are utilizing more and more log- and sensor data in their daily work. Our team’s business problem is to integrate this data into Scania’s development workflow, in order to enable data-driven development. This integration is end-to-end, i.e., from deciding and testing new functionalities, to evaluating performance and investigating deviations in our rolling fleet.
   

  

 Today this team consists of four data engineers, mainly focusing on the back-end operations. You will be complementing the team by focusing more on the front-end part of the operations while also supporting the Product Owner communicating and onboard users, meanwhile also understand their needs to ensure those are being reflected in our roadmap. Our team is a front-runner on enabling data-driven development at Scania and you can be a key player in forming that journey by:
   

  

  

* Facilitate engaging demo sessions to showcase and explain the latest features, ensuring users have a clear understanding of their benefits.
* Support internal customers (e.g., mechanical engineers, software developers, system owners) by helping them leverage their data through suitable tools, methods, and models tailored for their specific use case.
* Assisting the product owner in identifying use cases and refining the product by incorporating insights from customer feedback sessions.
* Provide support for cross-referenced data contextualization and automated analytics.
* Enable shorter feedback loops for product and embedded SW development.


**Who you are?**
 Technical curiosity is important, and you enjoy sharing newfound knowledge with team members and other peers. You have a customer-first mindset, and you can adjust your communication to the knowledge level of your customer.
   

  

 With a creative approach to problem-solving, you are able to find solutions to existing use cases and can identify new use cases without relying on a pre-defined problem.
   

  

 You see the benefits of working with a data-driven approach and encourage other people to realize the possibilities of this way of working.
   

  

**Relevant background**
* MSc or higher in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, or similar.
* Proficiency in Python and SQL, meritorious with experience of MATLAB.
* Experience in relational databases, with hands-on experience in Snowflake.
* Solid understanding of software development principles, including coding standards, testing and deployment practices.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
* Merit:
* Experience working in the automotive industry.
* Experience with working with analyzing millisecond time-resolved data or other large-scale tabular data sources.
* Experience in an analytic role.


**Further information**
 For additional information about the position please contact Group Manager, Henrik Bertilsson at Henrik.Bertilsson@Scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, cover letter, and copies of any certificates. Kindly apply with no later than 2025-01-02.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2020, we delivered 66,900 trucks, 5,200 buses as well as 11,000 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 125 billion, of which over 20 percent were services-related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 50,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com, https://www.youtube.com/@ScaniaTrucksBuses/featured.

title: Software Engineer - Roku (Brightscript)
description:
**Description**
**About the Team**
 We are passionate about technology and building fantastic software products. We are experts and leaders in the realm of video streaming. It’s no coincidence that some of our customers are giants like Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Our mission is to innovate continuously and to disrupt the industry by creating a scalable platform for building impactful video applications. Accedo One , our award-winning produc t is a testament to Accedo’s expertise and leadership worldwide.
   

  

 To continue to excel, we are growing our team with multiple openings! We’re looking for a Roku Engineer to join our team in Stockholm. (Did we say we have offices all over the world, including Stockholm, Budapest, London, New York, Toronto, Sydney, and Hong Kong, amongst others?). At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting edge technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Premium pension plan
* Company life, health and injury insurance
* Yearly health allowance
* Yearly training budget - which can be spent on IT conferences or online trainings
* Nice, spacious downtown office in the hip neighborhood of Södermalm
* Flexible home office options.
* Opportunity to participate in Hackathons and a range of company events


**What You Will Do**
 Primarily software development of Roku/Brightscript applications. You will work on delivering the Roku application of our state-of-the art products.
   

  

* You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining large-scale, high availability front-end applications and owning the related platform infrastructure (e.g AWS services, build pipelines, automated testing, etc).
* You will also be responsible for promoting a sound engineering culture through hands-on development, code reviews, contributing to the improvement of the application architecture and enhancing engineering processes
* This is the team you want to join! We care about software craftsmanship, constantly improving our work and ourselves while having fun doing it!


**Requirements**
**What We Are Looking For**
* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related discipline
* 3 - 5 years professional experience developing software applications
* Experience with Brightscript/Roku’s SceneGraph XML
* Experience integrating open source or 3rd party API’s and Libraries highly desirable
* Excellent problem solving skills and love for technical challenges
* Experience in Video and media based development projects (DRM, OVPs, Advertising, Analytics)
* Good command of English

title: Data Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Leya is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $37M in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Leya is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

 The role:
   

  

 Are you passionate about AI and eager to work on groundbreaking projects? Do you want to be a part of a rock-star team in a promising startup, collaborate with industry leaders and make a real impact in the legal landscape? Here's your chance!
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features and improvements across our data pipelines
* Monitor and ensure data freshness and health across many different sources
* Take ownership of our data pipelines and data warehouse, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Helping break down tasks and ensure their effective execution
* Work with some of the latest technologies and some of the smartest engineers in the industry
* Be challenged and grow very quickly as a developer


 Who you are:
   

  

* Skilled: You have a proven track record of developing reliable data pipelines and you are not afraid of responsibility for important and mission-critical software.
* Innovative: You thrive in a dynamic start-up environment where problems don’t always have obvious or easy solutions. You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about data and architecture. You are curious and passionate about writing good software, and you’re ambitious about learning and improving yourself as an engineer.
* Autonomous: Although constantly working in a team we believe in self leadership and ownership! You value feedback, take initiative without needing direction, and focus on outcomes. You are not afraid to try new things and learn from your mistakes rather than play it safe.
* Entrepreneurial: Leya is an ambitious start-up. Things move fast, tasks and challenges may be demanding, and responsibilities may change over time. But you’ll get to work with a team of brilliant and dedicated people that are all working to solve difficult problems and really change how legal work is done.


 Preferred qualifications:
   

  

* 2+ years writing data pipelines with Python, SQL and some modern orchestration tool
* Dagster (Prefect, Airflow or similar also ok)
* Python
* SQL


 Additional experience that’s a plus:
   

  

* IaC (Pulumi or Terraform)
* CI/CD pipelines
* Azure
* Elasticsearch
* Kubernetes


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Leya with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Leya for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Development Engineer Test and Performance, R&D Asia
description:
Scania has decided to establish a third industrial hub in China with the capacity to produce some 50,000 vehicles per year. Alongside building a new factory and an expansion of the sales network we will also establish a local R&D organisation in China. Our mission in R&D Asia is to develop trucks specially adapted for the Chinese market, the biggest commercial vehicle market in the world.
   

  

 Are you ready for the greatest adventure of your life? Then come and write Scania history together with us at Powertrain Development R&D Asia as a Development Engineer within Test & Performance!
   

  

**Your Work Tasks**
 A dedicated organisation will carry out the work, developing and managing the products over time. We work mainly in the early stages and with concept development. The organisation will consist of colleagues from all brands within the TRATON Group together with many new colleagues from China. We are building the organisation simultaneously as we develop the product. We are now looking for an additional development engineer to help us develop the powertrain systems, engine performance, and emerging fuels.
   

  

 The main work tasks will be working close to the vehicle with preparing the truck, test drive, analysing the performance, suggesting solutions/improvements, and presenting results to the organisation. The starting point for the powertrain is the Scania combustion engine, exhaust treatment system, and gearbox. However, to be successful in the Chinese market we have to adapt the premium powertrain to meet the challenging product cost target in the B+ segment.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 You have an extensive background in automotive and powertrain development, preferably with experience from Scania. Most likely you have worked with testing, calibration, and performance for powertrain, or in similar areas. You are hands-on and enjoy solving problems during the testing of trucks. You are structured and thorough in your work and can lead projects, create test reports, and present to the organisation. We believe you have a passion for technology and understand cause-and-effect relationships in a technical system. This position is great for you who dare to challenge the current technology to find more cost-efficient solutions.
   

  

**Education**
 We believe you have a master's degree in engineering, or other higher education, and have experience in the automotive industry for at least 5 years. You are highly proficient in both spoken and written English (English Level C1 - CEFR) and can work with Microsoft Office suite, Matlab, INCA, or similar. CE driver's license is a demand for the position and experience with testing software is a merit.
   

  

**More Information**
 Please contact Andreas Tjärning, Group manager Pre-development Powertrain, email: andreas.tjarning@scania.com
   

  

 During the Christmas holiday season, you can expect delays in the replies. We hope for your understanding.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and copies of grades or diploma. Scania uses tests in the recruitment process. A background check may be conducted for this position. Selection and interviews will start after the application period, in week 3 in January 2025. Apply via scania.com/career as soon as possible, but no later than January 12, 2025.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 If you already are a Scania employee, you log in and apply via MySuccess/Careers.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: Senior Cloud Data Engineer - Clickstream
description:
****The role****
 At Kindred, data and analytics are crucial to our growth and innovation as we expand into new markets. We are seeking a Senior Cloud Data Engineer with extensive experience in clickstream data to join our Analytics Tech team. In this role, you will manage our clickstream data architecture on AWS, ensuring the generation of high-quality datasets that accurately reflect customer behaviour across various digital platforms.
   

  

 You will work with cutting-edge technologies, including Snowplow for event tracking, Amazon Redshift for data warehousing, dbt cloud for data transformations, and Open Metadata for data governance. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you'll help define and implement next-generation data architectures that drive actionable insights and enhance operational efficiency. If you're passionate about leveraging data to understand customer behaviour, we invite you to take the next step in your career with us at Kindred.
   

  

****What you will do****
* Equip analysts and other teams with efficient models for decision making, marketing, product reporting, analysis analysis.
* Drive automation initiatives by building schemas that facilitate automated data processing workflows, aligning with the long-term vision for Redshift
* Drive the adoption of dbt as a service by providing training, support, and documentation, while ensuring data models are scalable and efficient.
* Develop and deploy a semantic layer to connect dbt models with natural language querying tools, enhancing data access and analysis for business users.
* Optimize time-to-insight through effective use of dbt and optimization of Redshift data structures.
* Share expertise in data collection and transformation practices to promote awareness of tracking and dbt across the organization.
* Support proof-of-concept generative AI initiatives to explore opportunities for operational efficiencies and business growth.
* Stay updated on advancements in data collection, transformation, cloud, and AI technologies, bringing innovative ideas to data engineering practices.


****Your experience****
* Strong understanding of clickstream data and data collection.
* Strong background in data modelling, particularly in clickstream data modelling.
* Extensive experience with data build tools such as dbt, and advanced data modelling skills.
* Understanding of AWS DevOps practices
* Experience in implementing governance frameworks.
* Experience with data catalogues to document processes and data models for maintainability and knowledge transfer.
* Excellent proficiency in SQL, Python, or any other programming language (advantageous).
* Experience in introducing technical efficiencies as code optimisation and process improvements, such as ways of working.
* Ability to manage ambiguity, exhibiting a willingness to learn through iterative processes and demonstrating a proactive attitude.
* Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications for data models.
* Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering large analytical projects while effectively managing stakeholders.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* In addition, it would be advatangeous to have:
* AWS certification.
* dbt certification.
* Experience as a digital analytics implementation developer.
* Knowledge of Python.

title: Staff Software Engineer – JVM/Rust Expert (Bangkok-based, Full Relocation Package Provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Get to know our team – Observability Platform in Agoda**
 Within the WhiteFalcon team, we build and maintain Agoda’s time series database and log aggregation system. We process tens of millions of measurements per second and hundreds of terabytes of logs per day in multiple datacenters, powering thousands of dashboards and alerts. Our biggest challenges are to support the ever-growing need for collecting more data, faster and at lower cost.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Build fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable solutions running in multi-tenant environments
* Solve challenging problems in distributed and highly concurrent environment
* Impact all developers in Agoda, providing better observability instruments


****What You’ll Need To Succeed****
* At least 8 years of experience writing performant and scalable code using JVM (Java/Scala/Kotlin) or Rust (C++) languages
* User/dev experience of one of the following products: Prometheus, InfluxDB, Victoria Metrics, Elasticsearch, Grafana Loki
* Production experience with messaging queues (Kafka)
* Deep understanding of concurrency and multithreading
* Value code simplicity and performance
* Demonstrate proficiency in communication and collaboration skill


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Strong background in DB internals, indexes, data formats (AVRO, Protobuf)
* You generally understand observability data types, such as logs and metrics
* Profilers, debuggers, tracers hide no secrets from you, especially in a Linux environment
* Experience building large-scale time series data stores and monitoring solutions
* Experience with S3 (Ceph), Elasticsearch, Grafana and other open-source components
* You can get down to the low-level when needed

 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations.
